content: Pause in silence a few seconds in rememberance of those that have given the ultimati sacrifice for all of us. "...gather around their sacred remains and garland the passionless mounds above them with choicest flowers of springtime....let us in this solemn presence renew our pledges to aid and assist those whom they have left among us as sacred charges upon the Nation's gratitude,--the soldier's and sailor's widow and orphan." --General John Logan, General Order No. 11, 5 May 1868
reply: Pause in silence a few seconds in rememberance of those that have given the ultimati sacrifice for all of us. "...gather around their sacred remains and garland the passionless mounds above them with choicest flowers of springtime....let us in this solemn presence renew our pledges to aid and assist those whom they have left among us as sacred charges upon the Nation's gratitude,--the soldier's and sailor's widow and orphan." --General John Logan, General Order No. 11, 5 May 1868
title: Memorial Day

content: If you are able, save for them a place inside of you and save one backward glance when you are leaving for the places they can no longer go. Be not ashamed to say you loved them, though you may or may not have always. Take what they have taught you with their dying and keep it with your own. And in that time when men decide and feel safe to call the war insane, take one moment to embrace those gentle heroes you left behind. Major Michael Davis O'Donnell 1 January 1970 Dak To, Vietnam It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.
reply: If you are able, save for them a place inside of you and save one backward glance when you are leaving for the places they can no longer go. Be not ashamed to say you loved them, though you may or may not have always. Take what they have taught you with their dying and keep it with your own. And in that time when men decide and feel safe to call the war insane, take one moment to embrace those gentle heroes you left behind. Major Michael Davis O'Donnell 1 January 1970 Dak To, Vietnam It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.
title: Memorial Day

content: It seems to me that on Memorial Day, we recognise that all of us who are normally strangers in the same land, for this day, can share in the long chain that goes back in time, and stretches endlessly into the future. That for one day we should pause and reflect; we are all bound together by those who sacrificed everything so that we can be here in a free country, a free land. That the benefits that we take for granted, had and have a price. The only true memorial, stronger than any memorial raised up in stone, is to pause and honor them. Stone weathers, but strong beliefs are passed down forever from generation to generation.

title: Memorial Day

content: Just think of all we would not have, had they not been there for us over the centuries. Such tremendous opportunity bought with their blood. Greater love hath no man. . . .
reply: Just think of all we would not have, had they not been there for us over the centuries. Such tremendous opportunity bought with their blood. Greater love hath no man. . . .
title: Memorial Day

content: quote: Originally posted by Motive25: I thought I would put this thread back at the top for today- where it belongs- above Nancy Pelosi, gay senators, beer taxes, Dick Cheney and the WND. Could everyone else help??? In memory of our fallen... Hooah. No such thing as too many threads memorializing the fallen. Thank you, heroes. You are missed, but you are never forgotten. In loving memory of SFC Bill XXXX You were my friend. I regret that I never knew you as more than that. You deserved more from me than that. RIP, Sergeant. I will care for your family as my own. Always and forever. I talked to your wife just this morning. Iraq took your life, but your wife still holds your soul. Rest deep. As long as I live, they are protected and cared for. Not as you protected and loved, but I was always second to you. In this, I am proud. You are free from our burdens. And your loved ones are loved in return. Go rest high on that mountain. <tears> Goodbye for now, Bill. I love you. You were always my brother. You were never my brother. </tears> Enjoy your rest, Bill. We'll all soon be reunited. Thank you for all you did and all you taught me and all you've yet to teach me. It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.
quote: Originally posted by Motive25: I thought I would put this thread back at the top for today- where it belongs- above Nancy Pelosi, gay senators, beer taxes, Dick Cheney and the WND. Could everyone else help??? In memory of our fallen...

I talked to your wife just this morning. Iraq took your life, but your wife still holds your soul. Rest deep. As long as I live, they are protected and cared for. Not as you protected and loved, but I was always second to you. In this, I am proud. You are free from our burdens. And your loved ones are loved in return. Go rest high on that mountain. <tears> Goodbye for now, Bill. I love you. You were always my brother. You were never my brother. </tears> Enjoy your rest, Bill. We'll all soon be reunited. Thank you for all you did and all you taught me and all you've yet to teach me. It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.

content: He was just a 21 year old kid who love and missed his family. Now most of them have joined his in Heaven. provided by the the kind and loving heart of a special friend. God and the soldier, All men adore, In time of trouble, And no more; For when war is over, And all things righted, God is neglected - The old soldier slighted. title: Memorial Day

content: To all who now wear the uniform of the United States of America and those who have worn the uniform and sworn the oath, THANK YOU!... To Sergeant Sherman R. Shaw 158th RCT and your blood that flowed on the ground in the Philippines, Private Woodrow H. Shaw and for your blood that flowed on the ground in the Aleutians, to John L. Shaw an officer in the U.S. Merchant Marine who became a sworn officer of the law and for your blood that flowed on the streets of our nation, Dennis Keith Spc.4 who gave his life in a muddy field in 'Nam in '68, LtCmdr. Culler from VA-81 who gave his life in a field across from 103rd St. at Cecil Field, to keep his A-7E from crashing into cars on 103rd St., Lt. Michael A. Talcott VA-195 who answered the call on a night launch from the U.S.S. America CV-66 and never came home, Lt. Michael Speicher VA-81, who is still missing... To all of my shipmates, to all who serve now and who will serve, THANK YOU... May we live worthy of your sacrifice... Most Respectfully, SUNLINER81
reply: To all who now wear the uniform of the United States of America and those who have worn the uniform and sworn the oath, THANK YOU!... To Sergeant Sherman R. Shaw 158th RCT and your blood that flowed on the ground in the Philippines, Private Woodrow H. Shaw and for your blood that flowed on the ground in the Aleutians, to John L. Shaw an officer in the U.S. Merchant Marine who became a sworn officer of the law and for your blood that flowed on the streets of our nation, Dennis Keith Spc.4 who gave his life in a muddy field in 'Nam in '68, LtCmdr. Culler from VA-81 who gave his life in a field across from 103rd St. at Cecil Field, to keep his A-7E from crashing into cars on 103rd St., Lt. Michael A. Talcott VA-195 who answered the call on a night launch from the U.S.S. America CV-66 and never came home, Lt. Michael Speicher VA-81, who is still missing... To all of my shipmates, to all who serve now and who will serve, THANK YOU... May we live worthy of your sacrifice... Most Respectfully, SUNLINER81
